content.title: Paternity Benefit Scheme (HBOCWWB)
content.department: Haryana Building and Other Construction Workers Welfare Board (HBOCWWB), Labour Department Haryana
content.details: The scheme 'Paternity Benefit Scheme (HBOCWWB)' was launched by the Haryana Building and Other Construction Workers Welfare Board (HBOCWWB), Labour Department Haryana. Under this scheme, financial assistance of ₹21,000/- (i.e. ₹15,000/- for proper care of the newborn baby and ₹6,000/- for nutritious food for the wife) will be given to registered male construction workers as paternity benefits. Further, the paternity benefits under the scheme will be given to registered male workers on the birth of child up to two children but expandable up to the birth of three daughters irrespective of the order of their birth.
benefits: Financial assistance of ₹21,000/- (i.e. ₹15,000/- for proper care of the newborn baby and ₹6,000/- for nutritious food for the wife) will be given to a registered male construction worker whose wife has delivered a baby.
The paternity benefit is given to the male registered worker for up to two children but is expandable up to the birth of three daughters irrespective of the order of their birth.
eligibility: The applicant should be a male construction worker.
The male worker should be registered under Haryana Building and Other Construction Workers Welfare Board (HBOCWWB).
The registered worker should have a minimum of one-year regular membership.
Only the registered worker whose wife has delivered a baby is eligible to avail of the benefits under the scheme.
The wife of the registered worker has not claimed the maternity benefit from any other employer.
documents_required: Identity proof i.e. Aadhaar Card, Voter Card
An undertaking stating that the wife of the applicant has not claimed the maternity benefit from any other employer.

faqs.question: What is the 'Paternity Benefit Scheme (HBOCWWB)' scheme?
faqs.answer: Under this scheme, financial assistance of ₹21,000/- (i.e. ₹15,000/- for proper care of the newborn baby and ₹6,000/- for nutritious food for the wife) will be given to registered male construction workers as paternity benefits.

faqs.question: Which department has launched this scheme?
faqs.answer: Haryana Building and Other Construction Workers Welfare Board (HBOCWWB), Labour Department Haryana.

faqs.question: Who is eligible to get the benefits of the scheme?
faqs.answer: Only the registered worker whose wife has delivered a baby is eligible to avail of the benefits under the scheme.

faqs.question: Can a general category male worker be eligible to apply under this scheme?
faqs.answer: Yes, this scheme is for all categories of workers.

faqs.question: Is this scheme only for a resident of Haryana State?
faqs.answer: Yes, the applicant should be a permanent resident/domicile of Haryana State.

faqs.question: What is the benefit of the scheme?
faqs.answer: Under this scheme, financial assistance of ₹21,000/- (i.e. ₹15,000/- for proper care of the newborn baby and ₹6,000/- for nutritious food for the wife) will be given to a registered male construction worker whose wife has delivered a baby.

faqs.question: For how many children will the paternity benefit be given to registered workers?
faqs.answer: The paternity benefit will be given to registered workers on the birth of up to two children but is expandable up to the birth of three daughters irrespective of the order of their birth.

faqs.question: In how many days the application form can be submitted to the Competent Authority?
faqs.answer: It is mandatory to submit the application form along with all the documents to the competent authority within one year of delivery of the worker’s wife.

faqs.question: Is the worker required to submit an undertaking?
faqs.answer: Yes, an undertaking stating that the wife of the applicant has not claimed the maternity benefit from any other employer.

faqs.question: How can a construction worker get registered under HBOCWWB?
faqs.answer: For registration, the construction worker should visit the Official Website of the Labour Department Haryana.

faqs.question: Is there any registration fee needed while registering under HBOCWWB?
faqs.answer: Yes, the first-time registration charges are ₹25/- and the registration fees vary according to the renewal time period.

faqs.question: How can a worker apply under the scheme?
faqs.answer: The eligible worker may apply online mode.

faqs.question: How can a construction worker apply online under the scheme?
faqs.answer: For online application, the construction worker should visit the Official Portal - Antyodaya-SARAL Portal.
